case_vignette: A 25-year-old man presents to the emergency department after numerous episodes of vomiting. The patient states that he thinks he ‘ate something weird’ and has been vomiting for the past 48 hours. He says that he came to the hospital because the last few times he "threw up blood". He is hypotensive with a blood pressure of 90/55 mm Hg and a pulse of 120/min. After opening an intravenous line, a physical examination is performed which is normal except for mild epigastric tenderness. An immediate endoscopy is performed and a tear involving the mucosa and submucosa of the gastroesophageal junction is visualized.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been vomiting a lot and I think I ate something weird; the last few times, there was blood in my vomit.
Have you had any abdominal pain or discomfort?
Yes, there's a mild soreness in the upper part of my belly.
Have you had any fever or chills?
No, I haven't had any fever or chills.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
No, my weight and appetite have been normal up until this started happening.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
No, my sleep patterns and energy levels have been normal until this started.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments?
No, I haven't traveled recently or been exposed to new environments.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
No, I haven't made any changes to medications or supplements recently.
Have you had any family history of gastrointestinal disorders?
I don't have any family history of gastrointestinal disorders.
Final Diagnosis: Gastrointestinal Bleeding
